item.description: Drawing from his newest book published by Harvard University Press, Melvin Konner, Professor of Anthropology and Associate Professor of Psychiatry and Neurology at Emory University, will present a sweeping overview of how relationships, emotion, and mind emerged from the uniquely human nature of children and how we care for them. It has been said that nothing in biology makes sense except in the light of evolution Dr Konner will show that nothing in childhood does either. Geological Lecture Hall
item.why: Part of the Evolution Matters Lecture Series. Understanding human origins must include the origins of childhood.
item.name: Evolution of Childhood: Role of Development in Explaining Human Uniqueness
